comments:
I got to a place where I would get "The command for the key you pressed failed" 
repeatably when I used Control-V to paste text into the JDT editor.

Here's what I did:
  * Place the cursor on a blank line in a method after a semicolon.
  * Press the TAB key. The cursor moves to the appropriate indent level, in 
this case three tabs.
  * Press Control-V.

The error appears. The contents of the clipboard don't matter - as long as it's 
not empty.

If I don't use TAB to indent before pasting -- if I paste while the cursor is 
sitting on a completely blank line -- I don't get the error.

I get "The command for the key you pressed failed" in an alert box. The alert 
gave no reason.

Here is the stack traceback from the error that appears in the Error Log view:

Please reopen if you still see this in newer builds
